item.title: A camera technique from the film "Creed"
item.description:
A camera technique from the film "Creed"

,

How They Pulled Off Creed's Two Biggest Shots: A-Camera Operator Ben Semanoff | Filmmaker Magazine

There are few moments in cinema as iconic as Rocky Balboa bounding up the steps of the Philadelphia Museum of Art, with Steadicam inventor Garrett Brown galloping alongside him off-screen.

item.title: Lighting Tip for "no budget" indie filmmakers.
item.description:
Lighting Tip for "no budget" indie filmmakers.

,

5 Considerations for One-Light Setups | Videomaker.com

item.title: In the gaily flamboyant footsteps of 'Zombadings'
item.description:
In the gaily flamboyant footsteps of ‘Zombadings’ | Inquirer Entertainment

,

In the gaily flamboyant footsteps of 'Zombadings'

PARDON filmmaker Lemuel Lorca if he has decided to display his CineFilipino best film trophy (for "Ned's Project") in his bedroom-making it the last thing he sees at night and the first thing he sees in the morning. The award is special to him because it's his first local recognition.

item.title: How to build great teamwork in your creative work
item.description:
How to build great teamwork in your creative work

,

Creative Collaboration: Building Team Dynamics for Your Production

By definition, collaboration is the act of working with someone to create something. When we set out to create a short film, a commercial or a documentary, we rarely do so in a vacuum. We work with others - cast and crew to bring a vision to life.

item.title: Limitations will lead you to your best film
item.description:
Limitations will lead you to your best film

,

The Paradox of Choice: How Limitations Can Help You Make The Best Film Possible

Have you ever walked into the ice cream store, saw 35+ flavors, and just couldn't decide? You walk away feeling worse about your chocolate mint because maybe you should've gotten the rocky road instead. Now, think about the last time you tried to sit down and write a script.

item.title: 'Do What You Love. You'll Be Better at It': Making Choices in Your Film Career
item.description:
'Do What You Love. You'll Be Better at It': Making Choices in Your Film Career

,

'Do What You Love. You'll Be Better at It': Making Choices in Your Film Career

It's hard to follow your dreams. For every thousand kids that want to be an astronaut, there are only a very few who actually end up in outer space. This is true for any endeavor, especially indie film, where the ratio of effort to reward can seem daunting (i.e., it might take years of working away with no reward to finally get your film made, or your script sold.)

item.title: 5 Sinag Maynila Filmmakers that inspire us
item.description:
5 Sinag Maynila Filmmakers that inspire us

,

A very 'Brillante' year

CHALLENGES were aplenty during the shoot of the five entries in this year's Sinag Maynila film festival. Joselito "Jay" Altarejos recalled that his film, "TPO," underwent several "script and treatment changes" during filming. The gritty adult drama, which tackles domestic violence, inevitably became a litmus test for Altarejos. "So many things happened.

item.title: Berlin film festival: director defends eight-hour movie that features hour-long lunch break
item.description:
Berlin film festival: director defends eight-hour movie that features hour-long lunch break

Filipino director Lav Diaz says movies should not be judged by their length, so he gave the Berlin film festival a historical drama about the Philippines that runs more than eight hours.

item.title: How 3 Women Made Estonia's 'Fargo' in 6 Weeks
item.description:
How 3 Women Made Estonia's 'Fargo' in 6 Weeks

Meet Fargo's European counterpart: Mother, a new crime thriller from Estonia. Directed by Kadri Kousaar , Mother exposes the vermin beneath the quaint veneer of life in a small town. It's a quietly thrilling whodunit that demonstrates mastery of nuanced character humor. Like Fargo, it deals in absurdity and lurches toward a grim twist.

,

How 3 Women Made Estonia's 'Fargo' in 6 Weeks

item.title: 8 Somewhat Unusual Excuses I Give for Not Working on My Screenplay
item.description:
8 Somewhat Unusual Excuses I Give for Not Working on My Screenplay

,

8 Somewhat Unusual Excuses I Give for Not Working on My Screenplay

For every word I've ever written on a screenplay, there was an equal number of excuses in my head not to write them. Screenwriters, you know. You might be using one right now to not work on your screenplay.
